alert.note: Alert for Sonoran Desert Natl Monument (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Phoenix (Central Arizona and California Desert)
info.headline: Freeze Warning issued February 01 at 10:29PM MST until February 03 at 8:00AM MST by NWS Phoenix
info.description: ...FREEZE WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 11 PM WEDNESDAY TO 8 AM MST THURSDAY... * WHAT...Temperatures in the low 30s expected. * WHERE...Sonoran Desert National Monument. * WHEN...From 11 PM Wednesday to 8 AM MST Thursday. * IMPACTS...Frost and freeze conditions will kill crops, other sensitive vegetation and possibly damage unprotected outdoor plumbing. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...These will be the coldest overnight and early morning low temperatures in weeks. Consider taking actions to protect plants, pets, people, and any pipes that may be susceptible to freezing. Travel with care, especially if any moisture on roadways is able to freeze.
info.instruction: Take steps now to protect tender plants from the cold. To prevent freezing and possible bursting of outdoor water pipes they should be wrapped, drained, or allowed to drip slowly. Those that have in-ground sprinkler systems should drain them and cover above- ground pipes to protect them from freezing.
